notes: Evidence lacks a direct inter-IE relationship between 'schedulingrequestid' and 'periodicityandoffset'. The evidence provided only describes behavior within individual IEs.

meta.evidence:
A UE can be configured by schedulingRequestID-LBT-SCell a configuration for consistent LBT failure recovery, as described in [11, TS 38.321], in a PUCCH transmission using either PUCCH format 0 or PUCCH format 1. The UE can be provided, by phy-PriorityIndex in SchedulingRequestResourceConfig, a priority index 0 or a priority index 1 for the SR. If the UE is not provided a priority index for SR, the priority index is 0 .  The UE is also configured a periodicity \( S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }} \) in symbols or slots and an offset \( S R_{\text {OFFSET }} \) in slots by periodicityAndOffset for a PUCCH transmission conveying SR. If \( S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }} \) is larger than one slot, the UE determines a SR transmission occasion in a PUCCH to be in a slot with number \( n_{s_{1} f}^{\mu}[4 \), TS 38.211] in a frame with number \( n_{f} \) if \( \left(n_{f} \cdot N_{\text {slot }}^{\text {frame }, \mu}+n_{s_{f} f}^{\mu}-S R_{\text {OFFSET }}\right) \bmod S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }}=0 \).
---
The UE is also configured a periodicity \( S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }} \) in symbols or slots and an offset \( S R_{\text {OFFSET }} \) in slots by periodicityAndOffset for a PUCCH transmission conveying SR. If \( S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }} \) is larger than one slot, the UE determines a SR transmission occasion in a PUCCH to be in a slot with number \( n_{s_{1} f}^{\mu}[4 \), TS 38.211] in a frame with number \( n_{f} \) if \( \left(n_{f} \cdot N_{\text {slot }}^{\text {frame }, \mu}+n_{s_{f} f}^{\mu}-S R_{\text {OFFSET }}\right) \bmod S R_{\text {PERIODICITY }}=0 \).
---
